p: As the Ebola epidemic expanded during the beginning of 2019, there were additional calls to reassess the exclusionary policy of withholding the vaccine from pregnant and lactating women and their infants. By the close of January 2019, the DRC National Institute for Biomedical Research had begun revising the vaccination protocol to include pregnant and lactating women within Ebola contact rings in their ongoing immunization efforts. This new policy was endorsed and supported by WHO SAGE at their meeting in Beijing on 20 February 2019.
